snippet: Novak Djokovic lost his momentum in the second half of last season and was toppled as the world number one by Andy Murray because his work-rate dropped, the Serbian's former coach Boris Becker said on Wednesday....
lead_paragraph: Novak Djokovic lost his momentum in the second half of last season and was toppled as the world number one by Andy Murray because his work-rate dropped, the Serbian's former coach Boris Becker said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Djokovic Has Not Worked Hard Enough, Says Becker
headline.main: Djokovic Has Not Worked Hard Enough, Says Becker
